data.note: Uganda's fiscal year runs July through June so we estimate the 2015 budget by combining half of the 2014/15 and 2015/16 annual budgets. Roughly a third of the budget comes from the Government of Uganda, a third from UETCL and a third from international donors. A 5% levy is placed on the cost of energy purchases made by UETCL that is used to fund the REA. Some capital is available to off-grid solar companies through the Uganda Energy Credit Capitalisation Company but this is provided outside of the Rural Electrification Agency and its budget.
data.name: Rural electrification budget

data.note: The base upfront cost is $42.97 made up of a $12.74 (UGX 41,300) inspection fee and $30.23 (UGX 98,000) connection fee. For customer's further away from the grid who require new poles, the connection fee increases to $100.57 (UGX 326,000), making the total cost of connection $113.1.
data.name: New connection cost
